text: - My name is Mike Guerra.
I work for AT&T.
I'm a director in product marketing
in the FirstNet organization.
And I have the privilege

to manage the Next
Generation 9-1-1 Portfolio.
The mission for Next Generation 9-1-1

is really to shave
seconds off of an event,
and it's to enable everything you and I do

with our cell phones with
our family and friends,
to be able to do with a 911 call taker.
And there's a lot of computing power.
There's a lot of security concerns.
There's a lot of reliability concerns.

And the partnership between
AT&T, Next Generation 9-1-1,
and AWS GovCloud based solutions
like Carbyne's APEX 911,

really, really opens up
a tremendous opportunity
in the industry for adoption.
You know, when I think about 911
and the importance of it,
I'm extremely proud to work for AT&T.

We were there 50 years ago
for the first 911 call,

and we're leading the way
in Next Generation 9-1-1.

We are one of the few
nationwide 911 platforms,

and it really allows us to
service the whole country.
When we looked for key partners,
AWS GovCloud was a clear candidate,

a clear, solid choice
for us to partner with.

Their presence, their
ability to serve the country
with full reliability was critical to us.

And as we brought the
partnership together,

we were seeing benefits that
we hadn't even planned on.

AT&T is extremely proud to be
partnering with AWS GovCloud,
and we can absolutely say

that this partnership is
helping to save lives.

One recent example where
AWS GovCloud really helped

in an emergency are during
the recent hurricanes.
A lot of 911 centers were underwater.
People weren't able to get there.
So the partnership between AT&T

and AWS GovCloud really
enabled remote workers
to log in anywhere and take calls
while they would've been stranded
trying to get to their center.

So the other trend
inside of public safety,
and like I said earlier,
the mission of Next Generation 9-1-1 is
to really enable all the multimedia

that we are able to do with
our family and friends,
but be able to do that

during the most important
call you'll ever make
to a 911 call taker.
So sharing video of a fire
and letting them know what type of truck
they would have to send,
or what direction to send the trucks
is really important,
and again, helps save lives
by shaving seconds off of that call.
And the need for multimedia

is really burdening the
on-premise equipment
that most 911 call centers have today.

And the need to move that
hardware from the premise base
where you have limited capacity

and computing power to the
cloud is really critical

to allow the 911 call takers
to adopt this technology.
And if you stay reliant on the prem-base,
that adoption will be much slower.

So one of the trends we've
talked about is the movement
from a prem-based solution

to a cloud-based solution
in a 911 environment.
And that is really critical

as we talk about enabling
all the multimedia

that we want to share
with the 911 call taker
to help reduce the response time.
And I would really recommend to any agency
or 911 center looking at it,
to take a really good look
at the AT&T Next Gen 9-1-1 solution,
partnered with AWS GovCloud
to really bring a highly reliable,
government grade security platform
that they could depend on

and know it's gonna be
there when they need it.
